required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multiple-Dose Pharmacokinetics Study of Two Gefapixant (AF-219/MK-7264) Formulations
clinical_study.official_title: A Study in Healthy Subjects to Assess the Multiple-Dose Pharmacokinetics of Two AF-219 Formulations

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the multiple dose pharmacokinetics (PK) of two gefapixant (AF-219) formulations; to assess the effect of omeprazole on the multiple dose PK of two gefapixant formulations; and, to assess the safety and tolerability of gefapixant.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration profiles of two different oral formulations of gefapixant
primary_outcome.description: Plasma gefapixant concentration versus time profiles will be plotted for each subject; similar summary plots will be constructed for each treatment period. Plasma gefapixant PK parameters will be calculated using noncompartmental methods and summarized using descriptive statistics by each treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration profile of gefapixant following administration of omeprazole
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) will be performed on log normal-transformed Cmax and AUC0-t values to determine the extent of a drug interaction, if any, of omeprazole on the plasma gefapixant PK parameters.

arm_group.description: Gefapixant oral tablets (25mg, 50 mg) administered twice daily for 13 days + Omeprazole oral capsules (20 mg) administered once daily for 8 days

intervention.description: 20 mg oral capsules administered once daily for 8 days
Gefapixant oral tablet (25 mg administered as a divided 50 mg tablet) administered twice daily for 5 days
Gefapixant oral tablet (50 mg tablet) administered twice daily for 8 days
